intro: Aneilema hookeri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually bright pink or purple and bloom throughout the year in suitable conditions. Aneilema hookeri is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in warm, humid environments.
